image.altText: composite of banks,, a wanted poster and Kym Parsons over a map of the locations hit

props.synopsis: Over 10 years, the notorious "bicycle bandit" terrorised innocent bank tellers at gunpoint. His identity remained a mystery for almost two decades until police used a game changing forensic technique to unmask the culprit.

title.children: Unmasking the bicycle bandit: How cops caught the notorious armed robber

image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: An investigation has found 18 staff either engaged in misconduct or inappropriately accessed the records of a patient who died after a hit and run crash last year, understood to be the son of the state's police commissioner.

title.children: 18 SA Health staff resigned or sanctioned for accessing Charlie Stevens's medical record

image.altText: A blurred photo of a man outside court after his brother was charged with criminal neglect

props.synopsis: A South Australian father has been denied bail after he allegedly inflicted injuries to his daughter consistent with her being "thrown into a wall".

title.children: Court told three-month-old sustained brain injury as father is denied bail

image.altText: A blurred black-and-white photo of a small boy apparently with a bandaged head.

props.synopsis: The man and the child's mother are alleged to have raised $60,000 in donations over two weeks.

title.children: Adelaide father who allegedly faked son's cancer diagnosis granted bail

image.altText: A close-up photo of a young man wearing a collared shirt and tie.

props.synopsis: The deputy state coroner has found the advice given by a social worker at a mental health triage centre to 20-year-old Kobee Huddy before his death was "not satisfactory".

title.children: Coronial inquest finds mental health triage service was not satisfactory before shooting death

image.altText: Kay Lawrence smiles, she has grey hair. Wears dark rimmed glasses and weaves threads together with her hands

props.synopsis: Women's suffrage was the work of many hands, and two tapestries that celebrate Australia's part in that story, and that were woven by more than 1,000 members of the public, are in pride of place at a new exhibition.

title.children: The story of women's suffrage was partly woven in SA, and is told in two tapestries

image.altText: South Australia's Treasurer Stephen Mullighan.

props.synopsis: South Australia's government has reported a mid-year surplus, but the state's Treasurer says there won't be more big spends like the Torrens to Darlington and Women's and Children's Hospital projects until they are completed.

title.children: SA debt grows due to infrastructure and health, despite mid-year surplus

image.altText: Lisa Lines smiles as she sits behind a desk with her hands clasped together

props.synopsis: A woman accused of plotting to murder her ex-partner will have to defend the charge in South Australia’s Supreme Court after failing to prove there was insufficient evidence to commit her to trial.

title.children: Woman loses bid to have attempted axe murder charge thrown out of court

image.altText: daughter holding photo

props.synopsis: Sonja Kurtzer was a "trailblazing feminist" who inevitably lost her identity in an attempt to seek "spiritual healing". Now, her daughter Ellen Bertani is on a quest for justice.

title.children: Ellen's mum sought 'spiritual healing', then stopped counselling and medication

image.altText: An ancient axe next to a ruler

props.synopsis: A South Australian teacher who collected hundreds of objects starting in the 1960s is now trying to sell them, but Indigenous leaders say they should instead be put on display in a "keeping place" that doesn't yet exist.

title.children: Sale of large collection of South Australian Aboriginal artefacts opposed

image.altText: Raygun posted a video on her Instagram account last night to announce the matter had been resolved.

props.synopsis: Raygun, of Paris Olympic fame, says the legal dispute with comedian Steph Broadbridge is over and no legal fees will be sought.

title.children: Raygun says parody musical legal drama has been resolved

image.altText: A short woman with auburn hair is surrounded by men walking and looking serene

props.synopsis: The 72-year-old had the choice to stay anonymous and undertake the trial in secret. She chose the opposite, saying she wanted to prevent what happened to her happening to anyone else. WARNING: This story contains details of sexual assault.

title.children: All 51 men found guilty in French mass rape trial that turned Gisèle Pelicot into a feminist hero

image.altText: A man wearing a three-piece suit arriving at a Miami court house.

props.synopsis: Craig Wright has long claimed he invented Bitcoin, and brought a $1.9 trillion lawsuit against Twitter founder Jack Dorsey's payment company Block.

title.children: Australian who claimed to invent Bitcoin jailed for filing $1.9 trillion lawsuit

image.altText: Fani Willis, wearing a pink blouse and pearl necklace, sits in a court dock.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Trump successfully argued Fani Willis, a Democrat district attorney in Georgia, should be disqualified from the case after she had a relationship with a lawyer she hired to lead it.

title.children: A secret love affair sank a prosecutor's chance to take down Trump

image.altText: A woman wearing a sari and sunglasses smiles while shaking hands with a man in Indian attire

props.synopsis: Muslim-majority Bangladesh and Hindu-majority India enjoyed close relations for decades. That changed in 2024.

title.children: A political 'husband-wife' relationship has ended badly in South Asia

image.altText: Composite of a man and woman smiling.

props.synopsis: A "significant volume" of foreign language material allegedly found on the devices of two accused Russian spies will need to be translated, delaying the case.

title.children: 'Significant delay' in alleged Russian spy case over volume of evidence

image.altText: Two women stand waist deep in water at a beach.

props.synopsis: People are warned against swimming at many of Hobart's beaches after industrial waste from the Cadbury chocolate factory takes a treatment plant offline, leading to untreated sewage flowing into the River Derwent.

title.children: Hobart beaches contaminated after Cadbury chocolate factory knocks out sewage plant

image.altText: Rain water gathers over the ground in a regional area.

props.synopsis: After days of storms and flash flooding in the south-east, the north is now copping a soaking.

title.children: Prepare to leave warning issued for parts of Townsville

image.altText: Vladimir Putin, at a press conference, holding his hand up to his head like a telephone.

props.synopsis: The Russian president says "the other side" of negotiations will need to compromise to bring an end to the Ukraine war.

title.children: Putin says he's ready to 'negotiate and compromise' with Trump on Ukraine

image.altText: A court sketch shows a three people sstanding before the court and a man (the accused) in the middle in a black suit.

props.synopsis: Accused CEO killer Luigi Mangione has been charged with new federal charges of stalking and murder by firearm, the latter which could bring the possibility of the death penalty if he is convicted.

title.children: Luigi Mangione could face death penalty under new federal charges

image.altText: capitol hill building in washington dc in the background with a red stop sign in the foreground

props.synopsis: The president-elect had pressured Congress to tie up loose ends before he takes office on January 20, but members of the Republican Party's right flank refused to support the package.

title.children: Trump-backed spending deal fails as government shutdown fast approaches

image.altText: People on platform and at the departures board at Sydney's Central train station

props.synopsis: The Rail, Tram and Bus Union has accused NSW Police of "scaring the public" over threats to cancel the New Year's Eve fireworks due to industrial action potentially impacting public safety.

title.children: Sydney train chaos threatens NYE fireworks says police, union disagrees

image.altText: A screenshot of a false news story about payments ith the words "dodgy website" stamped over it in red

props.synopsis: These websites might seem like victimless enterprises, but there are real-world consequences for people who get tangled up in the lies.

title.children: Scammers exploit Google to lure victims through Centrelink payment rumour

image.altText: A young woman with long blonde hair smiles, sitting on the ground surrounded by pots of colourful flowers.

props.synopsis: Jasmine Waddington had envisioned her life revolving around sports before a medical condition greatly restricted her physical abilities at the age of 15. But she's found a new career path, thanks to her grandmother.

title.children: Woman discovers pigface passion after life 'completely changed' by POTS diagnosis

image.altText: A generic photo of ASX board.

props.synopsis: The ASX200 fell to its lowest level since September, following the US Federal Reserve's decision to revise down its expectations for interest rate cuts in 2025.

title.children: ASX closes at three-month low — As it happened

image.altText: A woman wearing black robes and a grey headdress standing at a brown lectern and media microphones alongside a picture of a man

props.synopsis: The lawsuit alleges the US government is discriminating against Palestinian Americans by abandoning them in a war zone despite actively working to rescue Americans of other backgrounds.

title.children: Americans trapped in Gaza file lawsuit accusing US government of discrimination

image.altText: The Princess of Wales and her family sit smiling at the camera in a rural setting with green trees in the background

props.synopsis: The holiday card's image may look familiar to fans, since it's a still from the video in which Kate announced the end of her chemotherapy treatment.

title.children: Prince William and Kate release poignant Christmas card after 'brutal' year

image.altText: Several Palestinians looking through the bombed out interior of an apartment, seen through a destroyed building fascade.

props.synopsis: US and Arab mediators are working around the clock to hammer out a ceasefire deal between the Israeli government and terror group Hamas.

title.children: Israeli strikes kill 41 in Gaza as truce talks with Hamas continue

image.altText: A thick plume of smoke and red hazy sky

props.synopsis: More residents in the state's west under "leave immediately" warnings as hundreds of firefighters battle a blaze that has grown to 28,000 hectares.

title.children: Halls Gap under threat as Grampians bushfire grows, others test firefighters

image.altText: Ness stands with arms at her side, seen from the waist up, looking straight at the camera in front of green reeds and plants

props.synopsis: Australians living with deafblindness can be at increased risk of developing mental health issues, but as Vanessa Vlajkovic discovered, communication issues and a lack of understanding make it difficult for them to get meaningful help.

title.children: I have BPD, and being deafblind made it harder to get help

image.altText: Yayoi Kusama, with bright red hair, smiles and waves seated at bench covered in vibrant coloured prints also in background.

props.synopsis: The much-hyped NGV's Yayoi Kusama is the largest-ever exhibition of the Japanese artist's work in the southern hemisphere. We look at what drove Kusama's art and why her work evokes such conflicting emotions.

title.children: Kusama's infinity rooms offer moments of disorienting beauty

image.altText: A woman getting a blood test done

props.synopsis: Patients with disability often face considerable barriers when it comes to accessing clinical trials for new drugs and treatments.

title.children: Doctors 'moved mountains' to get blind patient on clinical trial

image.altText: A bee hive with honeycomb and bees everywhere.

props.synopsis: Beekeepers in Victoria are being kept busy as hives swarm in warm weather. On one job, the side of a farmhouse was "vibrating" with activity when beekeepers arrived to remove a 50-year-old hive.

title.children: Massive hive in wall takes beekeepers three days to remove

image.altText: Men looks at oncoming light rail tram in dark

props.synopsis: Despite the early morning alarm, commuters in Western Sydney were determined to ride Parramatta's new light rail as soon as it opened.

title.children: 'Moment in history': Commuters board first Parramatta light rail service

image.altText: Selfie photo with Mum, dad and two kids on the seats at the cinema waving and smiling to the camera

props.synopsis: Turning to handmade or experience-based gifts is helping families manage their budgets and reduce stress this Christmas, as cost-of-living pressures continue to pinch.

title.children: Families swapping presents for presence this 'cost-of-living Christmas'
